summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the status of deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case and its potential impact on scheduling in an Epstein-related FOIA litigation. The correspondence involves strategic planning for court submissions and coordination with The New York Times.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email inquiring about the status of deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case and noting potential impacts on an Epstein FOIA matter.

events.title: Strategy discussion for Epstein FOIA case
events.description: Prosecutors discuss the best course of action regarding court submissions and scheduling for an Epstein FOIA case, contingent on the status of deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case.

events.title: Initial inquiry about Noel DP status
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney requests an update on the status of deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case, noting it may affect timing in the Epstein FOIA litigation.

locations.context: Office location of the Assistant United States Attorney mentioned in the email signature.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal DOJ coordination between the 'Noel' case and an Epstein-related FOIA litigation.
Prosecutors planned to submit a schedule to the court by Friday, April 30, 2021, for in camera review by May 14, 2021.
The U.S. Attorney's Office intended to communicate with The New York Times regarding the FOIA case timing without revealing substantive details.
The status of deferred prosecution agreements in the 'Noel' case was a determining factor for scheduling in the Epstein FOIA matter.
All identifiable names of U.S. Attorney's Office personnel are redacted in the document, indicated by placeholders like '(USANYS)'.
